hr.fer.zemris.java.cstr

Class CString

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.cstr.CString

  • public class CString
extends java.lang.Object
    A reconstruction of java.lang.String from Java7. For all other informations look for guideance in String.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Juraj Pejnovic

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CString(char[] data)
      Creates a CString from the entire given char array.
      CString(char[] data, int offset, int length)
      Creates a new CString from the given char array with the start of new CString at the offset position of the array and with given length.
      CString(CString original)
      Creatres a new CString with the contents the same as the given CString.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CString

        public CString(char[] data,
               int offset,
               int length)
        Creates a new CString from the given char array with the start of new CString at the offset position of the array and with given length. Throws IllegalArgumentException if given null array or invalid offset or length.
        Parameters:
        data - array with characters fro new CString
        offset - where does the CString start in relation to the given array
        length - length of the CString

      • CString

        public CString(char[] data)
        Creates a CString from the entire given char array. Throws IllegalArgumentException if given null.
        Parameters:
        data - array containing elements of the new CString

      • CString

        public CString(CString original)
        Creatres a new CString with the contents the same as the given CString.
        Parameters:
        original - original CString

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        returns the created CString

      • charAt

        public char charAt(int index)
        Gets the character in the CString at the requested index. Throws IllegalArgumentException if requested index is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the requested character
        Returns:
        returns the character at the requested index

        Creates an array from the contens of CString.

        public boolean startsWith(CString cstring)
        Returns true if CString begins with the given CString, otherwise returns false. Thros IllegalArgumentException if given null.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if true, false if false

      • endsWith

        Returns true if this CString ends with the given CString, otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if true, false if false

        public boolean contains(CString cstring)
        Returns true if this CString contains the given CString, otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • substring

        public CString substring(int startIndex,
                         int endIndex)
        Creates a substring of CString starting and ending at the requested indexes. Substring starts at given startIndex, but endIndex is the index after the last character.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - starting index of the substring
        endIndex - one after the last index of the substring
        Returns:
        returns the new substring as a CString

      • left

        public CString left(int n)
        Creates a substring form CString's first n characters. Throws IllegalArgumentException if given length is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        n - number of characters we want extracted
        Returns:
        returns the requested substring

      • right

        public CString right(int n)
        Creates a substring form CString's last n characters. Throws IllegalArgumentException if given length is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        n - number of characters we want extracted
        Returns:
        returns the requested substring

      • add

        public CString add(CString cstring)
        Adds the given CString to the end of this CString to create a new CString.
        Parameters:
        cstring - CString to be added to this CString
        Returns:
        created CString from this and given CString

      • replaceAll

        public CString replaceAll(char oldChar,
                          char newChar)
        Creates a new CString with requested characters replaced with given characters.
        Parameters:
        oldChar - characters to be replaced
        newChar - characters to be replaced with
        Returns:
        returns new CString with replaced characters

      • replaceAll

        public CString replaceAll(CString oldStr,
                          CString newStr)
        Creates a new CString with requested substrings replaced with given substrings. Throws IllegalArgumentException if either is null.
        Parameters:
        oldStr - substring to be replaced
        newStr - substring to be replaced with
        Returns:
        returns new CString with replaced substrings
